g.t: The illness overcomes her, and Bionn loses control!
Eokeld has placed explosive barrels in the rigging, which will start falling in the next few turns!
You must get rid of the ball.
The ball carrier must start the match.
::name:: will be taken out of combat if this requirement is not fulfilled.
Following your victory, the crowd adores you: choose an upgrade for the rest of the competition.

t.bad: Some units do not have a bonus selected.

g.t: Lose all your progress in this arena?
You must register four companions to take part in this competition.
::name:: is coming to back you up!
::name1:: and ::name2:: are coming to back you up!
Apprentices encouraged by their master dig deep to get back up and fight to the end!
The sound of clashing metal rings from the other side of the arena!
Hiltrerd enters to avenge her apprentices and assert her dominance!
Hiltrerd recovers and uses a Relic of the Ancients!
The Broodmother's death ends the battle. Try to destroy as many plague-infested growths as possible to obtain alchemy reagents!
The Broodmother is dead. The rats are fleeing in a panic!
Rats are emerging from the holes!
The sun is rising. The rats are calming down.
The sun is setting. The rats are going feral!
Your Companions killed ::rat:: rats and destroyed ::nest:: plague-infested growths.
::name:: is running in fear, cowardly abandoning your troop!
Reach the escape area and get your Companions to flee.
Plague-ridden monsters are trying to enter the building!
Use the Find a way out skill to fill the gauge and flee!
Hold strong and find a way out.
Protect the Scholars while they're studying the relic.
You must register 6 Companions to take part in this match.
Each Companion must be assigned a position.
You must choose a Team Captain.
- Take a ball to the opponent's end zone to score 2 points.
- Have the other ball when your team scores to get 1 additional point.
- The team with the highest score at the end of the 8th round wins the game.
- You MUST score at least 5 points to win.

Each of the enemy captain's quips is associated with one of the following 3 actions: Attack, Parry, Taunt. Respond correctly by choosing the appropriate action:
- If you use Attack and the enemy uses Taunt, you will hit them. - If you use Parry and the enemy uses Attack, you'll avoid the hit. - If you use Taunt and the enemy uses Parry, you will gain the Upper Hand.
If both duellists strike at the same time, the one with the upper hand wins the point. If a duellist successfully parries while they have the upper hand, they counter.
You cannot use the same action twice in a row.
You have already used this action on the last turn.
The captain is already engaged in combat with another unit.
The ballista must be drawn to maximum tension to fire Belerion's Spear. Preparing to fire will take longer than expected.
::name:: has almost finished loading the ballista.
The ballista is ready to fire!
Alas, your Companions have wasted their only chance to take down the Sea Serpent.
The Sea Serpent is vulnerable – kill it!
The Sea Serpent is calling in reinforcements!
You cannot use this skill if the Companion is engaged in combat.
You can only use this skill if the Companion is engaged in combat.
You cannot use this skill if the Companion is disarmed.
You cannot use this skill if the Companion is dying.
You must start the turn of one of your units to end the turn.
This skill was already used in this fight.
You have already used a Bravery in this round.
Shows of Force are not available until round ::round::.
You cannot use this skill while wearing the Small Gauntlet.
This oil has already been applied to this weapon. This skill will have no effect.
You have already applied an oil to this weapon in this fight. The previous oil will be replaced.
Your last Companion has left your troop.
All your Companions perished in this battle.
The Sea Serpent has destroyed your Companions' boat.
These Companions form your core troop. New recruits will join you later.

Your session will be disconnected after a long period of inactivity.
Check your troop's Fatigue to know when you need to set up camp and rest. Use the campfire to cook a nice meal and get some sleep.
Your troop has rested long enough for now.

Krowns are the basic currency. You must pay your Companions' wages every ::nbRest:: Rests.

You must feed your Companions before each Rest: make sure you have enough Food in stock.

Your troop’s Happiness evolves over time.
Make sure it remains positive so Companions don’t leave the troop.

Your Reserve hold the Companions you do not wish to have in the camp. They cannot be assigned tasks, but must be fed and paid normally.

::plagued:: bit ::victim:: while they were resting and gave them a plague-infected wound.
::name:: has been drinking too much and is now an alcoholic!

::name:: could not digest the meal from the night before and is ill.

t.bad: Your Companions are dissatisfied!

::name:: slept too close to the hive and was stung by bees.
::parent1:: and ::parent2:: have become parents. ::child:: joins your troop.
::parent:: has brought a child into the world. ::child:: joins your troop.
::unit:: bit ::target:: during their Rest and does not require food for the next ::value:: meals.
Some Companions were bitten overnight and gained Fury: ::names::.
Flowers were found during the Rest.
The prisoner ::name:: escaped while everyone was sleeping...
As no one was keeping watch, the prisoner ::name:: escaped during the Rest.
The prisoner ::name:: tried to escape, but was stopped by ::allyName::, who was sleeping nearby.
After being thwarted in their attempts, the prisoner ::name:: finally managed to escape...
After knocking out ::allyName::, the prisoner ::name:: managed to escape. ::allyName:: was injured in the process: ::injury::
The prisoner ::name:: knocked out ::allyName:: to escape. ::allyName:: was injured in the process: ::injury::

t.bad: Prisoner ::name:: chose death over the troop's abuse.

g.t: If you rest now, your troop will be unhappy:
Your Knowledge of the world has increased.
A stolen item in the chest has been laundered.
::name:: died after being given a fatal poison.
The proximity of the ::item:: has made some Companions ::status::.
When dangers abound, an attack can occur while your troop Rests.
You have been attacked while you were Resting!
Can increase a weapon's level and enhance its attributes. Only some special weapons can be upgraded.
[JOBASSIGN] The current research will end in ::count:: Rests.
No Companion assigned. No new discoveries will be made during the next Rest.
Do you want to stop the current research? You will lose the work done on this item.
You restored the codex successfully. You will be able to decipher it after learning the corresponding runes.
You must place ::nb:: runes to attempt a restoration.
You deciphered the codex successfully. You will be able to understand the clue after deciphering all of the codices in this collection.
You must find the ::nb:: runes associated with the codex in order to decipher it.
It's still illegible. None of these runes matches.
We have a lead. One of the runes is correct.
Getting closer, but a rune is missing...
Crystal clear! All 3 runes are correct!

Restore damaged codices to discover which runes they hold.
Once restored, they remain unintelligible until you learn all of the corresponding runes.

You must choose a piece of equipment
You do not have the ingredients required to alter ::name::
Can improve the quality of a piece of equipment, which increases its attributes.

The assigned unit level is not high enough to make this recipe.
The assigned unit cannot make this recipe.
This barrel has reached its maximum degree of ageing.
Impale a body on the stake
This body cannot be kept as it is badly decayed. Destroy it?
Companions are inconvenienced by the foul smell pervading the camp.

You already know this strategy.
You must have a Strategy Table.
You already know this song.

g.t: Whipping your Companions can encourage them to produce more resources when they are assigned to production equipment in a camp.
Some units have already been whipped. Do you really want to whip them again?
This unit is not assigned to any production equipment in a camp.
According to the pendulum, there is nothing here.

Resolutions can be used to motivate your troop until the next Rest. You can enable different resolutions during the same day. Each use of a resolution increases its cost. Each Rest reduces the cost of all unused resolutions.
Do you want to enable ::name:: for ::value::?
Warning: Your troop is getting tired. Resolutions last until the next Rest.
The Coterie of Taps and Tipples
Do you want to enable ::name:: for ::value::?
::name1:: and ::name2:: will each lose a negative trait.
::name1:: and ::name2::'s relationship will decline. They will both get the trait ::trait::.
You have no negative personality trait.
This Companion does not have any relationships within the troop.
This hideout is well defended. Better weaken it before launching an assault! Its occupants are probably roaming the area.
There are still a few Bandit groups in the region. Find and eliminate them to weaken this Lair!
This hideout is about to fall. Let's launch the final assault!
This troop has just been ambushed by your Companions who will have an advantage in the fight.
Your Companions have just ambushed their targets and will have an advantage in the fight.
Your Scouts' morale is too low to explore this building.
Your Scouts' morale is too low to continue any further.
Your Companions have fled the building.
Your Scouts are too noisy to explore this building.
You can no longer look for an exit until the next round.
If you leave this place, you will lose your progress. Are you sure you want to leave?
A Vacancy Notice has been published.
Visit a Forge in town to buy some.
You do not have any wages to pay to your Companions.
Wages still to be paid to your Companions.
Place the Piton near a cliff.
The terrain is not stable enough.
The piton is too far from the troop.
The piton must be placed at the edge of a cliff.
The tomb is too far from the troop.

t.good: To progress in the scenario, explore the region or purchase information from the Informant.

g.t: Well done! You've finished the scenario for this region.
Following the path of Power and Glory, you have overcome many perils and defeated the mightiest warriors in the Five Kingdoms. Your company deserves its place amongst the strongest of the strong.
Your insatiable ambition and desire for wealth enable you to shape the world around you. You are no longer mere mercenaries: your company now wields the almighty power of money.
No lock can resist you, no one can stop you. Lords and Bandits alike fear you. Cunning and remorseless, your mercenaries have become princes among thieves.

Your Company has acted in the pursuit and service of Knowledge and unearthed hidden mysteries in the face of great danger. Your names now appear in History books alongside those of the greatest Scholars.
You haven't started on this path yet.

t.bad: Requires 1

g.t: Progress on the Path to discover this challenge.

t.bad: No destination available.
You need to build another Travel Post to travel there.

g.t: You need to build a Travel Post in this region to travel there.
Travelling with commercial goods requires paying additional taxes based on the sale value of these items.
Warning! A tax is added to the retrieval cost based on the sale value of the goods.

t.bad: You must choose a destination.
You must feed the troop during the trip.
You do not have enough Krowns to pay the commodity tax.

g.t: You must build a Travel Post in both regions.
Retrieving non-commercial resources from this Travel Post is free as they are connected by a trade route.
Retrieving Companions from this Travel Post is free as they are connected by a trade route.
Amount earned: ::xpWon:: Current amount: ::xp:: Amount for next level: ::xpNext::
::name:: stole ::itemName::. Selling the item earns you +::count::.

t.bad: Can only be used in the Tavern.
Wolves and cats can't live together

g.t: Some patrons had to be turned away for lack of space.

t.bad: You won't be able to increase your Prestige until you've moved into a larger Tavern.
None of the factions are present in the Tavern.

g.t: Welcome ::nb_reward:: ::faction_name:: to your Tavern to receive a reward. ::faction_name:: welcomed: ::value::
You have met the requirements for receiving this faction's reward.
This faction does not offer a reward.
Do you want to start a new Shift for ::cost:: ?
Reach ::value:: Prestige to unlock additional Shifts.

[LMB] Modify menu
The available options depend on the Scullion's level and the recipes the troop have learnt.

[LMB] Select beverage
The available options depend on the Brewer's level and the recipes the troop have learnt.
The number of available slots depends on the Scullion's level and traits.
Assign a Brewer to make alcohol.
Do you want to replace ::previous:: with ::next::? Your current stock will be lost.
The promotion items have changed (your menu can be updated).
::name:: can make at most ::value:: of each dish per Shift. All dishes will be made to order. Production therefore depends on the Sale Odds.
The higher the price is compared to the default, the lower the Sale Odds. An Upscale clientele will accept high prices more easily.

Cost of ingredients
This amount will be subtracted from the sales price for every completed sale.

Cost of ingredients
This amount will be subtracted from the sales price for every serving produced. Warning: high production can be expensive.
Alcohol that is in reserve cannot be sold.

Filling the barrel
If a Brewer is assigned and the barrel is not yet full, alcohol will be produced during each Shift. Alcohol production requires ingredients, and therefore costs money.

Barrel ageing
Each time this gauge fills up, the alcohol in the barrel adds a point to its ageing score , which increases its value.
It is still possible to produce alcohol in an aged barrel, but productivity declines with each , depending on the type of alcohol.
No alcoholic beverage can exceed two .

When a barrel is up for sale, the Brewer assigned to it will produce alcohol to make up for the quantity sold. When a barrel is placed in reserve, it will fill up more quickly and can then be aged.
Each ageing point increases the alcohol's sales price. Ageing does not cost resources.
Upgrade your Tavern to assign an additional Scullion.
Upgrade your Tavern to assign an additional Brewer.
Upgrade your Tavern to buy additional barrels.
Go to your cellar to upgrade one of your barrels.
Automatically supplies ingredients for cooking and brewing.
Each week, ::nbPromo:: items are offered at lower promotional prices. Recipes containing these ingredients will therefore be less expensive to produce.
Each week, there will be a shortage on ::min:: to ::max:: items. Recipes containing these ingredients will therefore be more expensive to produce.

t.bad: To prepare this dish, you must first have ::toProduce:: on the menu.
To prepare this drink, you must first have ::toProduce:: on the menu.

Meet the faction's requirements to attract them to your Tavern.

Do you want to shut down the Tavern?
Warning: This will erase all your progress with the Tavern. You will lose your equipment, your Prestige, and the civilians you have recruited. Companions assigned to the Tavern will return to the troop. You can start your Tavern's development over by going to Tiltren.
You can only replenish the Tavern's funds if its balance is negative.
You do not have enough Krowns to bail out the Tavern.
Rest to complete your first Shift and unlock this window.
Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

Repair damaged armour and shields with your ::item::
Heal your Companions with your remedies
While leaving the battlefield, you found ::name::'s corpse.

t.bad: ::name:: was captured while fleeing!

g.t: The merchants thank you for lending them a hand. You receive ::gold::.
You took care of ::name::, which has deepened the trust between you.
You healed ::name::, which has deepened the trust between you.
::name:: feels refreshed, which deepens the trust between you.
The recent shave he enjoyed has made him less fearful of the troop.
Feels happy in a troop that tends to his injuries.
Works to try and forget his predicament.
In chains, he scowls at the Companions.
Appreciates the troop's company despite it all.
Feels unhappy to be guarded by animals like mere cattle.
The recent facial she enjoyed has made her less fearful of the troop.
Feels happy in a troop that tends to her injuries.
Works to try and forget her predicament.
In chains, she scowls at the Companions.
Appreciates the troop's company despite it all.
Feels unhappy to be guarded by animals like mere cattle.
If you pay well, I'll come with you!
I'd like to discover new places and travel the world.
I am at your service, provided you pay me handsomely.
I won quite a few fights in the tavern. You can count on me.
If I join you, I'll no longer be a burden for my family.
I want to see the world before settling down.
Nothing scares me, and I'm a quick learner. You won't find a better Companion.
I was part of another group of Mercenaries, but one morning, they left without me...
As long as I eat my fill, I make a great Companion.
The Bandits took everything I had. I have nothing left to lose.
I'd rather become a Mercenary than beg on the market square.
I've had enough of my nightmare neighbours. Take me far away from here!
Don't be fooled by these rags. Before becoming a refugee, I used to be a soldier.
Don't be fooled by these rags. Before becoming a refugee, I used to be a soldier.
Just because the Legion didn't hire me doesn't mean I'm not worth my salt.
The nobles' wars are of no interest to me. What I want is a life of adventure.
I want to travel before joining an abbey.
I've always known that the life of a farmer wasn't for me.
I've always known that the life of a farmer wasn't for me.
Life in Gosenberg is much too quiet for me.
My family used to be part of the Broker Council. But today, I must sell my services to pay back my debts.
My services aren't free, but I guarantee you will be satisfied.
I need to save up for my son's wedding.
I've dreamt of becoming a Mercenary since I was a child.
I've dreamt of becoming a Mercenary since I was a child.
The Tules predicted I would thrive as a Mercenary.
Killing animals is good for Trackers! I need opponents who can put up a real fight!
All I ask for is honest wages and a life far from the swamps.
Promise to take me to the Tombs of the Ancients, and I'll join you.
I don't mind sleeping under the stars.
Free me! I promise, I'll never steal again!
I don't want to die here...
As long as I am well fed, I will follow you wherever you go!
This is a miscarriage of justice! I demand a trial by combat!
Pay for my freedom and I will be yours.
With its sharp eye and soft fur, this is the perfect everyday Companion.
The creature seems to beg for you to take it with you.
The patient animal is chewing on cabbage leaves.
How did it end up here?
::name:: is convinced you came back for it.
You know that ::name:: has recognised you. It lifts a hopeful gaze towards you.
Your betrayal has left ::name:: completely unresponsive.
Did you come back to free me? Oh, thank you!
Quick, free me! I can't wait to see the others!
At last! Do you know how long I have been rotting in this place?
This group has taken over the area and is threatening you.
The higher your Wanted Level, the more frequent the Guard's patrols will be.
You will be wanted by the Guard for this theft. Are you sure you want to proceed?
Selling stolen items will raise your Wanted Level with the Guard. Are you sure you want to proceed?
Word of your misdeeds has spread. It is now impossible for you steal anything without attracting attention.
The dubious origin of your items has raised suspicion, and you will not be able to sell them here as long as you are Wanted.
The dubious origin of your items has raised suspicion, and you have been unable to sell them. You are now Wanted. You should leave the area as quickly as possible!
::name:: got caught while committing theft! The Companion has been handed over to the Guard and sent to "::where::". You are now Wanted . You should leave the area as soon as possible!
::name:: has been spotted while attempting to commit a theft! You are now Wanted . You should leave the area as quickly as possible!
::name:: has been handed over to the Guard and sent to "::where::".
::name:: was handed over to the Guard and sent to "::where::" for the rest of his life.
::name:: was handed over to the Inquisition and sent to "::where::".
::name:: has surrendered to the Guard and was sent to "::where::".
::name:: has surrendered to the Guard and was sent to "::where::" for the rest of his life.

You can check file integrity or reinstall the game.

Show outlines of danger zones in combat
Allow the modification of the skill order in combat
Displays a list of the Companions in battle

Some players do not own this additional content: ::names::
If they had a flaw, it would be...
Progress in the game to unlock new Starting Regions.
The simulation difficulty affects your Companions’ tiredness, hunger and wages.
Wartales is a challenging game, be sure to reduce the difficulty level if it doesn't feel right.
You can change the difficulty at any time.
You want an easier combat experience.
Tactical battles and the possibility of losing Companions do not scare you.

You’re ready to walk straight into hell.
- Death is immediate. - Retreats come at a greater penalty. - Companions who flee are lost. - Enemy groups are faster. - Disengagement comes at a greater penalty. - Overall difficulty is at its maximum level.
Management difficulty is tailored to be flexible and unintrusive.
You will need to manage your Companions' hunger, fatigue and wages daily.
Surviving and saving money will be painful endeavours.

You will have to survive in merciless conditions.
- Happiness declines more quickly. - Prison sentences are final and irrevocable. - Certain professions are dangerous. - Merchants restock slowly. - Overall difficulty is at its maximum level.
Only one save per game, but you can go back at any time to certain checkpoints, like the last village you visited, the beginning of a battle, etc.
You can save at any time and make multiple saves of the same game.
One save, one chance! You cannot go back and any Game Over is irreversible. This is the most difficult and demanding game mode in Wartales!

You can choose between different save modes:
- Free Mode: You can save at any time and make multiple saves of the same game.
- Normal Mode: Only one save per game, but you can go back at any time to certain checkpoints, like the last village you visited, the beginning of a battle, etc.
- Ironmen Mode: One save, one chance! You cannot go back and any Game Over is irreversible. This is the most difficult and demanding game mode in Wartales!
The difficulty of all regions adapts dynamically to your group's size and your units' power. The game will always offer a challenge suited to your troop.
Each region of the world has a set difficulty from the start. You will have to expand and improve your troop before you can explore more dangerous areas and fight more powerful enemies.

You can explore the world of Wartales in two different ways:
- Free: Roam the world with complete freedom. Enemies will adapt to your strength as it increases, ensuring a difficulty level tailored to your team's abilities.
- Region-locked: Each region of the world has a set difficulty from the start. You will have to expand and improve your troop before you can explore more dangerous areas and fight more powerful enemies.

Your Companions are off in search of adventure!
After a few days of quietly travelling along, their only feat was not getting lost and they have reached their destination.
Here, surely, awaits some novel and exciting quest that will stir up the uneventful lives of bored apprentices!
Adventure awaits at the end of the road! For those who make it there alive, that is...

A Mercenary's life is never easy...
After a heated skirmish with Bandits, the most opportunistic of your Companions have fled, leaving behind a generous payment and a furious client...
Keen to make a few Krowns, but not at the expense of their own lives, they now need to find a new job...
Repairs and drinks won't pay for themselves, after all!

Enough is enough!
After bearing that horrible captain's abuse for far too long, your Companions can finally enjoy their well-deserved freedom.
Although...
Deserters are never a welcome sight, be it for their former colleagues or the locals who regard them as traitors for some reason...
They will need to keep their heads down, while still making a living...

Ah, the fresh scent of the morning breeze filled with the delicate tang of the nearby stables...
A good old-fashioned tavern brawl, where the furnishings make for perfect weapons...
Born and raised in the countryside, your Companions know the value of the simpler things in life.
But to make it in this world, one must take risks and go far afield in search of fame and fortune!
Just be careful not to lose what you value most along the way... That is to say, your shoes.

It was all very straightforward...
Petty theft, highway robberies, a purse of coins handed to a childhood friend now serving in the Guard, and your Companions always got off scot-free.
The simple honest life of a merry gang of Bandits.
Except for that one last score... The one that targets the wrong person... The victim who is out for revenge...
After running away in a very disorderly fashion, your troop has reached a new region.
Surely, here they will find many new opportunities to get rich quickly! After all, one person's loss is another one's gain...

Their Tavern will be the most famous in all the Five Kingdoms!
Your Companions are confident that with their innate talent for cooking and their love of fine drink, they've got what it takes to open the business they've always dreamed of.
Who cares that they don't know where the nearest village is and have only mastered two or three recipes? Becoming tavern keepers is their true calling!

At least your Companions are still alive!
That's more than they expected when the storm sank their ship, along with their dreams of piracy on the high seas.
Now stuck on dry land, they've got all the time in the world to discover the joys of day-long hikes, wild beast attacks, hostile villagers, and more!
But sailors are a resourceful lot. In time, they're sure to adapt and thrive!
